content.title: The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Allowance to Destitute Women Scheme
content.details: The scheme 'The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Allowance to Destitute Women Scheme' is implemented by the Directorate of Social Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands to provide financial assistance to the poorest and destitute women in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
benefits: The quantum of Allowance to Destitute Women shall be ₹2500/- per month subject to eligibility.
Payment of allowance shall be made through Bank Account on a monthly basis.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands or have resided in the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands for more than 10 years at the time of making the application.
The applicant should be a poor and destitute woman.
The household income of the applicant does not exceed ₹4000/- per month.
The applicant should not be availing of any kind of assistance or pension from the government.
content.application_process: Offline. The application form shall be available free of cost at the Directorate of Social Welfare, Port Blair and the sub-divisional offices of Child Development Project Officers (CDPOs). The application form can also be downloaded from the official website.
documents_required: Proof of income issued by the competent authority

faqs.question: How much financial assistance does the scheme provide?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides a monthly allowance of ₹2500/- per month to eligible beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How is the allowance disbursed?
faqs.answer: The allowance is disbursed through Bank Account on a monthly basis.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the Scheme?
faqs.answer: To be eligible for the scheme, the woman applicant must either be a permanent resident of the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands or have resided there for more than 10 years at the time of application.

faqs.question: How is the income eligibility determined for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The household income of the applicant should not exceed ₹4000/- per month to meet the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Can applicants receiving government assistance or pension still apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applicants who are currently availing any form of government assistance or pension are not eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: Where can one obtain the application form for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The application form is available free of cost at the Directorate of Social Welfare, Port Blair, and the sub-divisional offices of Child Development Project Officers (CDPOs). Additionally, it can be downloaded from the official website.

faqs.question: Who should the application be submitted to?
faqs.answer: The application form, along with the required documents, should be submitted to the offices of the concerned Child Development Project Officer.

faqs.question: What happens if a beneficiary fails to inform about a change of address or employment status within the stipulated time?
faqs.answer: Failure to inform about changes within 15 days will result in an inquiry by the Director of Social Welfare, and if necessary, the recovery of the allowance paid as arrears of land revenue.

faqs.question: Is there any fee for obtaining the application form?
faqs.answer: No, the application form is available free of cost.
